page.title: 15A HONING SATURDAY
page.content: In the morning on Saturdays we have to go to the music centre at Nth. Walsham about 5 miles away. Usually we go with Louise's dad in his car.When we arrive we get the chairs out for singing. One of the songs we sing is 'The Telephone Book Lullaby'. After singing we have a break. We have orange squash and a biscuit. After that Louise and I play our descant recorders. Laura teaches us. When we have finished we go into town to buy the household groceries. When we have been to the shops we go home. My dad takes us home. In the summer we then get the sunbeds out and lie on them. We have tea indoors, then we watch T.V. (Instruction at the music centre is provided by volunteers. Instruments taught include recorders, percussion, violins, flute, brass wind instruments -little instruction is done in school)
